title: WHO says to remain in Gaza City despite Israel's call to leave
subhead: Israel's army is intensifying its attacks on Gaza City – the main urban center in the besieged Gaza Strip – with the goal of seizing the city. The UN estimates that around one million Palestinians live in and around Gaza City.

title: Lecornu, far right's favorite Macronist, already threatened by Le Pen
subhead: For years, the Rassemblement National praised the former defense minister for his cordiality toward them. But as soon as his appointment as prime minister was made official on Tuesday, the far-right party's MPs condemned his future.

'Block Everything': While September 10 movement echoes the Yellow Vests, it also has key differences
subhead: While the call to 'block everything' on Wednesday, September 10, brings to mind the Yellow Vest protests of 2018, the choice of a weekday, the involvement of unions, and the support of left-wing parties give this social movement its own distinct character.

title: Blessed with fortune: India's Hare Krishna mega-temple backed by a Ford heir
subhead: In Mayapur, the monument built in honor of Krishna by his followers could, by 2027, become the largest religious building in the world. This colossal project, begun in 2010, has been largely funded by Alfred Ford, the great-grandson of the car manufacturer.
byline: By Sophie Landrin (Mayapur, India, special correspondent)

title: Behind the 'Block Everything' movement: Tight budgets and fear about the future
subhead: The surge in inflation in recent years is still being felt, fueling frustration among France's 'just-getting-by' population. Falling unemployment has not stopped the poverty rate from rising.
byline: By Béatrice Madeline and Cécile Prudhomme
